Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Sample Repository Link Missing?" (#457) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Description**

The Description link in the main repo links to this [Documentation](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/bb448854.aspx); however its `Samples on GitHub` just dumps you to the `OfficeDev` organization and not an actual samples on how to use the Open XML SDK...

Can a proper link be provided to the repo containing samples?  Especially UWP ones.

Thanks

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "OpenXML integration with Windows RMS (Right Management Services)" (#93) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
I got requirement to Export Excel with integrating the Windows AD RMS ( Active Directory Right management Service) integration.  I mean is there any way we can use ClosedXML or OpenXML SDK and create some security that Excel can be accessed by Users defined in AD RMS Security configuration??

I know it is complex requirement, and i did search but looks like there is no way at this moment.

Can any one did this before or is it possible at all  or  can any one provide any assistance on this?? 

thanks in advance.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add support for child insertion based on schema" (#676) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
Currently, the order in which items are inserted is very much dependent on hard coded values from a code generator. This change instead utilizes the information in the particle constraint that already exists on an item to determine where the child should be inserted.

This change introduces the ability to *compile* particle information into a list of paths to identify location of each element. This is then used during insertion to identify if an element should be added before or after the other. For details, please see the [README](https://github.com/twsouthwick/Open-XML-SDK/blob/particle-compiler/src/DocumentFormat.OpenXml/Framework/Schema/README.md)

Part of #492 

Fixes #680
